The Extended Integer (XInt) Library

Rationales

Interface

  • Why did you do X in the interface?
  • Then why didn't you follow those exactly?

Copy-on-Write

  • Why use copy-on-write? I've heard that causes problems with multi-threaded code.
  • Why are you using a roll-your-own system instead of boost::shared_ptr for the copy-on-write stuff?

Not-a-Number

  • Why have a Not-a-Number value?
  • Since you've got Not-a-Number, what about negative zero, and positive and negative infinity, like IEEE floating-point numbers?

Random generator

  • Why did you implement your own random number generator? You should use Boost.Random instead.
  • But why default to an insecure random number generator? Why not default to the secure one?
  • Okay, then why not make the developer provide one?
